reviews.review_msg: Brilliant man, it's sad that others can't see that. No, he does not have a power point display down with what you need for the exam, but he forces the students to think for themselves and engage the text.

This was the most horrible class I have taken as a student with an extended minor in English. Prof is a poor lecture who enjoys the sound of his own voice. I would not recommend him, nor ever put myself through the misery of taking another class with him. Four hour lectures are spent watching him rant while striking a desk to emphasize his points.

I was stuck taking a Mideval literature class, and was looking forward to a term of dread. Coley was so fantastic, I went on to take 404W Chaucer with him. He is dynamic, passionate, and loves close textual readings. If you follow his lectures (again, dynamic and interesting!) you're well on your way to writingGood papers.HeValues ideasOverGrammer.
Anne is an excellent teacher who cares about her students and the literature she teaches them.

Anne is a fantastic prof for people who are intelligent enough to actually LISTEN to what she's saying.  DUH, um, who's this Chaucer guy again?  Half the retards in the 204 class probably didn't even do the reading.
an admitted pedant who attempts to make his students pedants as well, he's extremely enthusiastic and knowledgeable about his subject

Matt is a great prof: passionate, inspirational, genuine nice-guy, knowledgable (and well dressed). He gives fantastic feedback-usually around half a page, typed-but it's worth noting that I've never seen him give a mark higher than an A- on a paper. It's annoying, but his feedback is always valid so I suppose those papers could have been better.
